In Europe, Ixodes ricinus is the primary vector for both Lyme borreliosis and tick-borne encephalitis (TBE), the most important tick-borne diseases. With an estimated 65 000 cases a year, Lyme borreliosis is responsible for the largest disease burden of any vector-borne disease in the European Union (EU).
